title: Global Micro Irrigation Market to reachUS$ 6.8 Billion by 2021 DecisionDatabases.com
text:
(MENAFN Press) The global micro irrigation market foresees a high CAGR of 17.4% from 2016 to 2021 according to a research report added by DecisionDatabases.com. The “Global Micro Irrigation Market Research Report - Industry Analysis Size Share Growth Trends and Forecast 2014 – 2021” anticipates the global micro irrigation market to touch US 6.8 billion by the end of 2021.
 
View the detailed report at:
http://www.decisiondatabases.com/ip/232-micro-irrigation-market-report
Micro irrigation market is gaining high momentum due to its vital role in increasing the crop yield. Irrigating the land using micro irrigation devices has shown better yield in terms of volume as well as in quality. Moreover the uncertain climatic condition decreasing water level and high population is making it essential to conserve water. Micro irrigation seems an apt technology in this market condition.
Government initiatives and product innovation in micro irrigation market will aid in reducing the cost of micro irrigation devices and making it more popular among small farmers. Though micro irrigation market is quite matured in North America and Europe to an extent Asia Pacific and Latin American regions still have huge untapped markets.
In this report the global micro irrigation market is segmented based on the product types as drip irrigation micro sprinkler irrigation and others. Global micro irrigation market is segmented on the basis of applications as field crops horticultural crops orchards turf and ornamentals and others. Geographically the report segments this market as Asia –Pacific region North American region European region Latin American region and the rest of the world.
 
The report explores the social economic and technological updates of the micro irrigation market. Strategic insights from the subject matter experts and industry insiders have been used to analyse the market trends future growth and opportunities.
The report mentions the financial and strategic plans along with the complete profiles of the key players in the Mirco Irrigation industry. Some of them are EPC Industries Jain Irrigation Systems Lindsay Corporation Nelson Irrigation Corporation Netafim Ltd Rain Bird Corporation Rivulis Irrigation T-L Irrigation The Toro Company Volmont Corporation among others.
